trans-unit.source: Represents a persistence service configuration element that specifies the type of the persistence provider implementation to use, as well as the time-out to use for persistence operations.
Additional attributes that appear in this element are passed into the constructor for the specified persistence provider.

Persistence provider configuration elements are typically defined in the application configuration file, under the `system.serviceModel` node, in the `serviceBehaviors` subsection of the `behaviors` section.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.PersistenceProviderElement"></xref> class.
Gets the type of behavior.
The type of behavior.
Creates a custom behavior based on the settings of this configuration element.
A custom behavior based on the settings of this configuration element.
Indicates whether this configuration element has been modified since it was last saved or loaded.
`true` if the element has been modified; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether an unknown attribute is encountered during deserialization.
The name of the unrecognized attribute.
The value of the unrecognized attribute.
`true` if an unknown attribute is encountered while deserializing; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the time-out used for persistence operations.
The default value is 30 seconds.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that specifies the time-out used for persistence operations.
Gets additional attributes of this <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.PersistenceProviderElement"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> object that contains additional attributes of this <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.PersistenceProviderElement"></xref>.
Called after deserialization.
Writes the contents of this configuration element to the configuration file.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that is used to write to the configuration file.
`true` to serialize only the collection key properties; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if any data was actually serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the type of the persistence provider to be used by the service.
The type of the persistence provider to be used by the service.
Modifies this configuration element object to remove all values that should not be saved.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> at the current level containing a merged view of the properties.
The parent <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref>, or `null` if this is the top level.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode"></xref> that determines which property values to include.
